   21: %%%-------------------------------------------------------------------
   22: %%% File    : ethread_SUITE.erl
   23: %%% Author  : Rickard Green <rickard.s.green@ericsson.com>
   24: %%% Description : 
   25: %%%
   26: %%% Created : 17 Jun 2004 by Rickard Green <rickard.s.green@ericsson.com>
   27: %%%-------------------------------------------------------------------
   28: -module(ethread_SUITE).
   29: -author('rickard.s.green@ericsson.com').
   30: 
   31: -export([all/0, suite/0, init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   32: 
   33: -export([create_join_thread/1,
   34: 	 equal_tids/1,
   35: 	 mutex/1,
   36: 	 try_lock_mutex/1,
   37: 	 cond_wait/1,
   38: 	 broadcast/1,
   39: 	 detached_thread/1,
   40: 	 max_threads/1,
   41: 	 tsd/1,
   42: 	 spinlock/1,
   43: 	 rwspinlock/1,
   44: 	 rwmutex/1,
   45: 	 atomic/1,
   46: 	 dw_atomic_massage/1,
   47: 	 thread_name/1]).
   48: 
   49: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   50: 
   51: suite() ->
   52:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   53:      {timetrap, {minutes, 10}}].
   54: 
   55: all() ->
   56:     [create_join_thread,
   57:      equal_tids,
   58:      mutex,
   59:      try_lock_mutex,
   60:      cond_wait,
   61:      broadcast,
   62:      detached_thread,
   63:      max_threads,
   64:      tsd,
   65:      spinlock,
   66:      rwspinlock,
   67:      rwmutex,
   68:      atomic,
   69:      dw_atomic_massage,
   70:      thread_name].
   71: 
   72: init_per_testcase(Case, Config) ->
   73:     case inet:gethostname() of
   74: 	{ok,"fenris"} when Case == max_threads ->
   75: 	    %% Cannot use os:type+os:version as not all
   76: 	    %% solaris10 machines are buggy.
   77: 	    {skip, "This machine is buggy"};
   78: 	_Else ->
   79:             Config
   80:     end.
   81: 
   82: end_per_testcase(_Case, _Config) ->
   83:     ok.
   84: 
   85: %%
   86: %%
   87: %% The test-cases
   88: %%
   89: %%
   90: 
   91: %% Tests ethr_thr_create and ethr_thr_join.
   92: create_join_thread(Config) ->
   93:     run_case(Config, "create_join_thread", "").
   94: 
   95: %% Tests ethr_equal_tids.
   96: equal_tids(Config) ->
   97:     run_case(Config, "equal_tids", "").
   98: 
   99: %% Tests mutexes.
  100: mutex(Config) ->
  101:     run_case(Config, "mutex", "").
  102: 
  103: %% Tests try lock on mutex.
  104: try_lock_mutex(Config) ->
  105:     run_case(Config, "try_lock_mutex", "").
  106: 
  107: %% Tests ethr_cond_wait with ethr_cond_signal and ethr_cond_broadcast.
  108: cond_wait(Config) ->
  109:     run_case(Config, "cond_wait", "").
  110: 
  111: %% Tests that a ethr_cond_broadcast really wakes up all waiting threads
  112: broadcast(Config) ->
  113:     run_case(Config, "broadcast", "").
  114: 
  115: %% Tests detached threads.
  116: detached_thread(Config) ->
  117:     case {os:type(), os:version()} of
  118: 	{{unix,darwin}, {9, _, _}} ->
  119: 	    %% For some reason pthread_create() crashes when more
  120: 	    %% threads cannot be created, instead of returning an
  121: 	    %% error code on our MacOS X Leopard machine...
  122: 	    {skipped, "MacOS X Leopard cannot cope with this test..."};
  123: 	_ ->
  124: 	    run_case(Config, "detached_thread", "")
  125:     end.
  126: 
  127: %% Tests maximum number of threads.
  128: max_threads(Config) ->
  129:     case {os:type(), os:version()} of
  130: 	{{unix,darwin}, {9, _, _}} ->
  131: 	    %% For some reason pthread_create() crashes when more
  132: 	    %% threads cannot be created, instead of returning an
  133: 	    %% error code on our MacOS X Leopard machine...
  134: 	    {skipped, "MacOS X Leopard cannot cope with this test..."};
  135: 	_ ->
  136: 	    run_case(Config, "max_threads", "")
  137:     end.
  138: 
  139: %% Tests thread specific data.
  140: tsd(Config) ->
  141:     run_case(Config, "tsd", "").
  142: 
  143: %% Tests spinlocks.
  144: spinlock(Config) ->
  145:     run_case(Config, "spinlock", "").
  146: 
  147: %% Tests rwspinlocks.
  148: rwspinlock(Config) ->
  149:     run_case(Config, "rwspinlock", "").
  150: 
  151: %% Tests rwmutexes.
  152: rwmutex(Config) ->
  153:     run_case(Config, "rwmutex", "").
  154: 
  155: %% Tests atomics.
  156: atomic(Config) ->
  157:     run_case(Config, "atomic", "").
  158: 
  159: %% Massage double word atomics
  160: dw_atomic_massage(Config) ->
  161:     run_case(Config, "dw_atomic_massage", "").
  162: 
  163: %% Tests thread names.
  164: thread_name(Config) ->
  165:     run_case(Config, "thread_name", "").
  166: 
  167: %%
  168: %%
  169: %% Auxiliary functions
  170: %%
  171: %%
  172: 
  173: -define(TESTPROG, "ethread_tests").
  174: -define(FAILED_MARKER, $E,$T,$H,$R,$-,$T,$E,$S,$T,$-,$F,$A,$I,$L,$U,$R,$E).
  175: -define(SKIPPED_MARKER, $E,$T,$H,$R,$-,$T,$E,$S,$T,$-,$S,$K,$I,$P).
  176: -define(SUCCESS_MARKER, $E,$T,$H,$R,$-,$T,$E,$S,$T,$-,$S,$U,$C,$C,$E,$S,$S).
  177: -define(PID_MARKER, $E,$T,$H,$R,$-,$T,$E,$S,$T,$-,$P,$I,$D).
  178: 
  179: port_prog_killer(EProc, OSProc) when is_pid(EProc), is_list(OSProc) ->
  180:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  181:     Ref = erlang:monitor(process, EProc),
  182:     receive
  183:         {'DOWN', Ref, _, _, Reason} when is_tuple(Reason),
  184:                                          element(1, Reason)
  185:                                          == timetrap_timeout ->
  186:             Cmd = "kill -9 " ++ OSProc,
  187:             io:format("Test case timed out. "
  188:                       "Trying to kill port program.~n"
  189:                       "  Executing: ~p~n", [Cmd]),
  190:             case os:cmd(Cmd) of
  191:                 [] ->
  192:                     ok;
  193:                 OsCmdRes ->
  194:                     io:format("             ~s", [OsCmdRes])
  195:             end;
  196:         %% OSProc is assumed to have terminated by itself
  197:         {'DOWN', Ref, _, _, _} ->
  198:             ok
  199:     end.
  200: 
  201: get_line(_Port, eol, Data) ->
  202:     Data;
  203: get_line(Port, noeol, Data) ->
  204:     receive
  205: 	      {Port, {data, {Flag, NextData}}} ->
  206: 		  get_line(Port, Flag, Data ++ NextData);
  207: 	      {Port, eof} ->
  208: 		  ct:fail(port_prog_unexpectedly_closed)
  209: 	  end.
  210: 
  211: read_case_data(Port, TestCase) ->
  212:     receive
  213:         {Port, {data, {eol, [?SUCCESS_MARKER]}}} ->
  214:             ok;
  215:         {Port, {data, {Flag, [?SUCCESS_MARKER | CommentStart]}}} ->
  216:             {comment, get_line(Port, Flag, CommentStart)};
  217:         {Port, {data, {Flag, [?SKIPPED_MARKER | CommentStart]}}} ->
  218:             {skipped, get_line(Port, Flag, CommentStart)};
  219:         {Port, {data, {Flag, [?FAILED_MARKER | ReasonStart]}}} ->
  220:             ct:fail(get_line(Port, Flag, ReasonStart));
  221:         {Port, {data, {eol, [?PID_MARKER | PidStr]}}} ->
  222:             io:format("Port program pid: ~s~n", [PidStr]),
  223:             CaseProc = self(),
  224:             _ = list_to_integer(PidStr), % Sanity check
  225:             spawn_opt(fun () ->
  226:                               port_prog_killer(CaseProc, PidStr)
  227:                       end,
  228:                       [{priority, max}, link]),
  229:             read_case_data(Port, TestCase);
  230:         {Port, {data, {Flag, LineStart}}} ->
  231:             io:format("~s~n", [get_line(Port, Flag, LineStart)]),
  232:             read_case_data(Port, TestCase);
  233:         {Port, eof} ->
  234:             ct:fail(port_prog_unexpectedly_closed)
  235:     end.
  236: 
  237: run_case(Config, Test, TestArgs) ->
  238:     run_case(Config, Test, TestArgs, fun (_Port) -> ok end).
  239: 
  240: run_case(Config, Test, TestArgs, Fun) ->
  241:     TestProg = filename:join([proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), ?TESTPROG]),
  242:     Cmd = TestProg ++ " " ++ Test ++ " " ++ TestArgs,
  243:     case catch open_port({spawn, Cmd}, [stream,
  244: 					use_stdio,
  245: 					stderr_to_stdout,
  246: 					eof,
  247: 					{line, 1024}]) of
  248: 	Port when is_port(Port) ->
  249: 	    Fun(Port),
  250: 	    CaseResult = read_case_data(Port, Test),
  251:             receive
  252:                 {Port, eof} ->
  253:                     ok
  254:             end,
  255: 	    CaseResult;
  256: 	Error ->
  257: 	    ct:fail({open_port_failed, Error})
  258:     end.
